title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

vmassol - (09:37): oanat: good morning. Note that we've decided not to use the Snippet prefix  
vmassol - (09:37): s/prefix/suffix/  
vmassol - (09:38): I don't know if it's a good idea but we should probably continue for consistency. I see you've kept the Snippet prefix for all your recent snippet renames  
oanat - (09:38): vmassol: Good Morning. I did not know we decided to not use it.  
vmassol - (09:39): oanat: also you seem to not be setting the contributor for snippets. We've been setting it to be the creator  
vmassol - (09:40): (and when it's one of the xwiki sas team member we set the license to LGPL when not supported by the xwiki dev team)  
oanat - (09:41): vmassol: so should I rename the snippets to remove the "Snippet" from the page name?  
vmassol - (09:41): oanat: to be consistent yes  
vmassol - (09:41): (note: you'll need to change the title too probably)  
oanat - (09:43): vmassol: ok, I will also add the contributor and LGPL

vmassol - (12:25): it's ok I can see them now  
silviar joined #xwiki at 12:25  
jstoldt joined #xwiki at 12:33  
jstoldt - (12:33): hey  
jstoldt - (12:33): hey, could somebody tell me if it's legitimate to make translations like these: jstoldt http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources?action=review&language=de  
jstoldt - (12:33): ?  
jstoldt - (12:34): it's one of those numbered translations  
jstoldt - (12:34): like "No included pages", "One included page", "n included pages"  
jstoldt - (12:35): unfortunately, in German i can't translate included in the same way in those three cases  
jstoldt - (12:35): so i just moved the translation into the second group sort of thing  
jstoldt - (12:35): so i wonder if this is alright or will it cause horrible injuries and possible death?  
vmandrilly joined #xwiki at 12:36  
sdumitriu - (12:40): jstoldt: Yes, that's valid  
sdumitriu - (12:40): But in this case you can just use one choice  
vmandrilly - (12:41): Hello! May I ask a coulple of questions?  
sdumitriu - (12:41): {0,choice,0#Keine eingebundenen Dokumente|1#Ein eingebundenes Dokument|1<}0} eingebundene Dokumente}:  
sdumitriu - (12:41): {0,choice,0#Keine eingebundenen Dokumente|1#Ein eingebundenes Dokument|1<{0} eingebundene Dokumente}:  
jstoldt - (12:41): sdumitriu: if this is fine i'll use that then  
jstoldt - (12:41): thanks  
jstoldt - (12:41): indeed  
sdumitriu - (12:41): vmandrilly: Go ahead  
vmandrilly - (12:41): I could install Xwiki Enterprise on my computer (windows).  
vmandrilly - (12:41): 1- How do I copy everything on my shared webhost (where I used to have a php+mysql website)?  
vmandrilly - (12:41): 2- How can I access it with adress in http://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX/ instead of http://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:8080/ which is something I have never seen on all the website I ever visit usually!  
jstoldt - (12:43): actually, i think it should prolly be changed in english, too... like this: {0,choice,0#No|1#One|1<{0}} included {0,choice,0#documents|1#document:|1<documents:}  
jstoldt - (12:43): so the : should only be there if there is something to be listed afterwards  
sdumitriu - (12:43): Right  
sdumitriu - (12:44): vmandrilly: Did you use the standalone installer, with Jetty bundled?  
vmandrilly - (12:44): I used the windows installer  
jstoldt - (12:45): jvelo: the result on the google doc viewer macro page is broken  
sdumitriu - (12:46): vmandrilly: Edit start\_xwiki.bat and change:  
sdumitriu - (12:46): set JETTY\_PORT=8080  
jvelo - (12:46): jstoldt, I know, I'm working on it ;)  
jstoldt - (12:46): okay, just wanted to mention it in case you missed it in the mass of things to do ;)  
vmandrilly - (12:46): sdumitriu: OK I try that  
jstoldt - (12:48): silviar: about generate pdf for children pages, the params mentioned in the info box are documented by now: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Exports#HPDFExport  
sdumitriu - (12:48): jstoldt: Actually in this case 0 documents will not happen at all, since the text is displayed only when there are documents  
jstoldt - (12:49): oh, i see. well, did not know that. anyway, it does not hurt the translation so i'll just keep it "fixed" ;)  
sdumitriu - (12:52): jstoldt: Improved the english translations, thanks for pointing that out  
sdumitriu - (12:52): vmandrilly: Does it work now?  
silviar - (12:52): jstoldt: cool, thx!  
jvelo left at 12:52 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
jstoldt - (12:52): you're welcome  
sdumitriu - (12:52): rrodriguez: Ping  
vmandrilly - (12:54): sdumitriu: question 2 solved. I reformulate question 1 : can I move files to my webhost in share version that uses Apache, or do I need to rent a dedicated server?  
sdumitriu - (12:55): vmandrilly: XWiki requires a Java Servlet container  
sdumitriu - (12:55): Apache alone can't run XWiki  
sdumitriu - (12:55): So, you need hosting which also provides Tomcat  
vmandrilly - (12:56): sdumitriu: so I just have to ask my host if they have Tomcat and servlet  
sdumitriu - (12:56): But you can upload a static export of the wiki  
sdumitriu - (12:56): This means, host the wiki somewhere else, create content, then export as HTML and upload the resulting files to Apache  
vmandrilly - (12:57): sdumitriu: this would defeat the purpose of a wiki...  
sdumitriu - (12:57): If you want the real wiki functionality, then you need Tomcat  
vmandrilly - (12:57): ok  
sdumitriu - (12:57): Or a virtual server where you can install your own container, be it Jetty or Tomcat  
silviar - (13:04): Hi! Any idea why it doesn't work to add a link in the form "platform:Features.Exports#HPDFExport" to an extension page?  
silviar - (13:04): it works when I add the full URL  
silviar - (13:05): this is the page I am working on  
silviar - (13:05): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Generate+Pdf+For+Children+Pages  
silviar - (13:05): (see the info section)  
mihaipaun joined #xwiki at 13:12  
jstoldt - (13:12): hmmm i am trying to create a Wiki Spaces Pie Chart snippet in Wiki 2.0 syntax  
jstoldt - (13:12): but it keeps failing for me  
jstoldt - (13:13): apparently something is wrong with how i declare my chart  
jstoldt - (13:13): {{chart type="bar" params="document:Main.Space-Größenübersicht;table:table1;series:rows" title="Dokumente pro Space in diesem Wiki" width="100%"/}}  
jstoldt - (13:13): can anyone spot the error?  
jstoldt - (13:13): http://pastebin.ca/2013699 << the complete code  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:13  
silviar - (13:24): vmassol: Hi!  Any idea why it doesn't work to add a link to "platform:Features.Exports#HPDFExport" in this extension page http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Generate+Pdf+For+Children+Pages ?  
vmassol - (13:25): silviar: yep I know why :)  
vmassol - (13:25): the page is in syntax 2.1  
vmassol - (13:25): anchors and query strings are specified differently  
vmassol - (13:25): [[….||anchor="…" queryString="…"]]  
silviar - (13:25): thanks :)  
vmassol - (13:26): so [[….>>platform:Features.Exports||anchor="HPDFExport"]]  
silviar - (13:27): fixed :) thanks  
vmassol - (13:27): cool  
jstoldt - (13:30): how can i determine the number of spaces in a wiki?  
jstoldt - (13:31): in velocity, that is  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 13:31  
jstoldt - (13:32): disregard that, got it  
sdumitriu - (13:32): $xwiki.spaces.size()  
jstoldt - (13:33): yeah, i used it in the wrong way... stupid me^^

sdumitriu - (16:45): sburjan: Ping  
silviar1 - (16:46): sdumitriu: Hi! Sorin is at school. He said he'll be back at 6 RO time (in 15 minutes)  
sdumitriu - (16:47): K, thanks  
sburjan - (16:48): sdumitriu: pong  
sdumitriu - (16:48): Hi sburjan  
sdumitriu - (16:48): Looking at XAIRCBOT-2  
sburjan - (16:48): yes ?  
lucaa left at 16:49 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (16:49): Was option 2 or 3 the most voted one?  
sdumitriu - (16:49): I thought it was 2  
sdumitriu - (16:50): It's 6 for 2, 3 for 3  
sburjan - (16:51): sdumitriu: wait just 5 minutes so I can check something  
sdumitriu - (16:53): Also, I don't really understand what this is supposed to do:  
sdumitriu - (16:53): +        for (User singleUser in pircUsers) {  
sdumitriu - (16:53): +              if (singleUser.equals(sender)) {  
sdumitriu - (16:53): +                     log(channel, "${date} <${singleUser.getPrefix()}${sender}> ${message}\n")  
sdumitriu - (16:53): +              }  
sburjan - (16:54): this get the prefix of the user. like @, + or nothing  
sburjan - (16:54): status of the user in channel  
sburjan - (16:55): for chan ops, voices or normal users  
sdumitriu - (16:55): Oh, OK  
sburjan - (16:55): if you don't want that, I can remove it  
sdumitriu - (16:55): No, it's OK  
sdumitriu - (16:56): sburjan: I cleaned up the patch a bit, you can start from http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/attachment/18192/XAIRCBOT-2.patch  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 16:57  
sburjan - (16:58): start what ?  
cjdelisle` - (16:58): heh just realized that the way showlog used to be was a security vulnerability. It never checked to make sure "lines" was a number so (had it worked) it would have been running anything anyone entered.  
sdumitriu - (17:00): sburjan: If you want to change the patch, you can start from my version  
sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 17:00  
jvelo - (17:00): sdumitriu, hi, do you happen to have clean up scripts for when you removed spam from myxwiki.org ?  
sburjan\_ left #xwiki at 17:00  
sdumitriu - (17:00): That is, apply my version on the trunk, build the app, import it, change it, export it  
sdumitriu - (17:01): jvelo: No  
jvelo - (17:01): ok  
sburjan - (17:02): sdumitriu: I want to see if syntax coloring works without the  < > . And if it does, we can remove them. Pygments doc sait it needs irssi syntax style, and this is why I've put < >  
sburjan - (17:02): \*said  
sburjan - (17:05): sdumitriu: the syntax coloring doesntw ork without the < >. So we have to chose, keep the <> and have coloring, or not and lose coloring. Should I send a new reply to the mailing thread ?  
sdumitriu - (17:06): Can you show me two screenshots in the two cases?  
sburjan - (17:06): yes .. on right on  
jvelo - (17:06): migration process: 2/3 done !  
sburjan - (17:07): jvelo: I will re-create the screenshots for Tag Application today :)  
sburjan - (17:08): haven't forgotten  
jvelo - (17:08): sburjan cool

jvelo - (17:19): sburjan ok. What's the bug ?

vmassol - (17:20): back!

abusenius - (21:57): a stupid question, is it normal that a parameterized hql query with "... and active.value = ? ...", where active.value is a Boolean does \*not\* work if the type of the passed parameter is Boolean?  
abusenius - (21:58): (on mysql)  
cjdelisle` - (21:58): Boolean or boolean?  
cjdelisle` - (21:58): I don't know if it matters but it's something to check.  
abusenius - (21:59): Boolean  
abusenius - (21:59): with Integer it works  
abusenius - (21:59): boolean wouldnt work because params are passed in a List<?>  
abusenius - (22:00): in principle I'm fine with Integer, but does it work the same with other DBs? :)  
abusenius - (22:01): (the active.value is the "active" property from XWikiUsers)

abusenius - (22:09): yes

abusenius - (22:09): (IMO)

sdumitriu - (22:10): True, False, and Undecided :)
